qas.question: When did classes first begin at Washington University?
What building was first used for classes at Washington University?
What three departments were Washington University divided?

answers.text: the Manual Training School, Smith Academy, and the Mary Institute

qas.question: What type of school did Washington University first function?
On what road was the Benton School building?
On what road was Academic Hall?
In what year did the university divide into three departments?
On what date did the first school year end?
In what year did Washington University become a day school?

context: Although chartered as a university, for many years Washington University functioned primarily as <a4_0>a night school<a4_0/> located on <a0_0><b5_0>17th Street<b5_0/> and <b6_0>Washington Avenue<b6_0/><a0_0/> in the heart of downtown St. Louis. Owing to limited financial resources, Washington University initially used public buildings. Classes began on <a1_0><b8_0>October 22, <b7_0><b9_0>1854<b9_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/>, at the <a2_0>Benton School building.<a2_0/> At first the university paid for the evening classes, but as their popularity grew, their funding was transferred to the St. Louis Public Schools. Eventually the board secured funds for the construction of Academic Hall and a half dozen other buildings. Later the university divided into three departments: <a3_0>the Manual Training School, Smith Academy, and the Mary Institute<a3_0/>.
